title: Genesis
text: In The Beginning, God made the heavens and the earth.

title: Genesis
text: The earth was empty and dark, and the Spirit of God was hovering over the surface of the waters.

title: Genesis
text: God commanded, ``Let there be light'', and there was light.

title: Genesis
text: God looked upon the light and found it to be good, then divided it from the darkness.

title: Genesis
text: God referred to the light as Day and the darkness as Night. Evening and morning marked the passing of the first day.

title: Genesis
text: God then commanded that a divide be created between the waters, separating them from one another.

title: Genesis
text: God created the sky and divided the water below it from the water above it, and so it was.

title: Genesis
text: God named the expanse Heaven. Then evening and morning came, ending the second day.

title: Genesis
text: God commanded  ``let the waters beneath the heavens gather as one, and let the dry land be revealed'', and so it was.

title: Genesis
text: God named the dry land Earth and the waters that had come together Seas, and God was pleased with what they saw.

title: Genesis
text: Then God commanded ``Let the earth produce grass, plants that bear seeds, and fruit trees that bear fruit with seeds'', and so it was.

title: Genesis
text: Vegetation and plants of various kinds were created by the earth, each with its own type of seed, and trees that produced fruit with their own seeds, and God was pleased with what they saw.

title: Genesis
text: Then evening and morning came, ending the third day.

title: Genesis
text: Then God commanded ``Let lights be placed in the sky to divide day from night. They shall serve as signs for the passage of time and for the seasons,

title: Genesis
text: and let their light shine in the sky to illuminate the earth'', and so it was.

title: Genesis
text: God created two luminous bodies, the larger one to preside over the day and the smaller one to oversee the night beside the stars.

title: Genesis
text: God placed them in the heavens to illuminate the earth,

title: Genesis
text: to have dominion over the day and night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God was pleased with what they saw.

title: Genesis
text: Then the sun set and rose, ending the fourth day.

title: Genesis
text: God commanded ``Let the waters be filled with life, and that birds soar in the sky above the earth.''

title: Genesis
text: God made all the fish that move through the water, as well as every type of bird, and God was pleased with what they saw.

title: Genesis
text: God blessed them, saying ``Be fruitful and multiply, fill the oceans with life, and let the birds multiply on the land.''

title: Genesis
text: Then evening and morning came, ending the fifth day.

title: Genesis
text: God then commanded ``Let the earth produce living creatures of all kinds- cattle, crawling critters, and wild beasts'', and so it was.

title: Genesis
text: Then they created the cattle and all crawling critters and wild beasts, and God was pleased with what they saw.

title: Genesis
text: Then God commanded ``Let people made in our image walk the earth, and give them authority over all the fish that move through the water, as well as every type of bird, as well as the cattle, and all the crawling critters, and the wild beasts.''

title: Genesis
text: Then God created the people in their reflection, in the image of God; male and female, God created them.

title: Genesis
text: God blessed the people and said ``Be fruitful and multiply, and take charge of the earth, as well as all the fish that move through the waters, as well as every type of bird, and the cattle, and the crawling critters, and even the wild beasts''.

title: Genesis
text: Then God said ``I have provided all the grass, the plants that bear seeds, and the fruit trees that bear fruit with seeds, which you can use as food,

title: Genesis
text: and all the fish that move through the water, as well as every type of bird, and the cattle, and all crawling critters, and even the wild beasts.'', and so it was.

title: Genesis
text: Then God looked upon all that they had created and was pleased. Then evening and morning came, ending the sixth day.

title: Genesis
text: The creation of all the elements of the heavens and the earth were completed, and of all that is in them. On the seventh day, God had finished working and rested.

title: Genesis
text: God bestowed a blessing upon the seventh day and declared it holy, for on that day, God rested from the labor of the creation.

title: Genesis
text: This is the story of the creation of the heavens and the earth. The days that God made the heavens and the earth.

title: Genesis
text: God had yet to bring rain to the land, as there was no one to tend to the soil.

title: Genesis
text: A mist rose from the ground and moistened the surface of the land.

title: Genesis
text: God then crafted Adam from the dust of the earth and breathed the breath of life into his nostrils, thus creating a living being.

title: Genesis
text: God planted a beautiful garden in Eden, to the east, and placed Adam there. God grew all sorts of trees in the Garden. They were pleasing to the eye and their fruit was nutritious.

title: Genesis
text: In the center of the garden stood two trees:

title: Genesis
text: The Tree of Life and The Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil.

title: Genesis
text: A river flowed through Eden providing water for the garden, which split into four branches.

title: Genesis
text: Pishon was the first of the rivers, and it encircled the entire country of Havilah, a place abundant in gold. The gold found in that land was of exceptional quality, as was the bdellium and onyx stones.

title: Genesis
text: Gihon was the second river; it encircled the entire region of Cush.

title: Genesis
text: The third river was called the Tigris, which flowed east of Assyria.

title: Genesis
text: The fourth river was the Euphrates.

title: Genesis
text: God then placed Adam in the Garden of Eden to tend and care for it.

title: Genesis
text: God instructed Adam, saying, ``You may eat from any tree in the garden, but do not eat the fruit from the Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil, for if you do, you will certainly perish''.

title: Genesis
text: God said, ``It is not good for one to be alone, so I will help them find a companion''.

title: Genesis
text: From the earth, God brought all the fish that move through the water, as well as every type of bird, and the cattle, and all crawling critters, and even the wild beasts.

title: Genesis
text: He then presented them to Adam to name them. Whatever Adam called each living creature, that became its name.

title: Genesis
text: Adam named all the fish that move through the water, as well as every type of bird, and the cattle, and all crawling critters, and even the wild beasts, but Adam could not find his companion.

title: Genesis
text: God caused Adam to fall into a deep slumber, and he drifted off to sleep. He then removed one of Adam's ribs and sealed up the wound.

title: Genesis
text: God then crafted Eve from the rib He had taken from Adam, and presented her to him.

title: Genesis
text: Adam had found his companion. ``She is a part of me, my equal; she shall be called: woman.''

title: Genesis
text: Their sons would leave their parents and devote themselves to their wife, becoming one.

title: Genesis
text: Adam and Eve were both naked, yet were comfortable in each other's presence.

title: Genesis
text: The serpant was more cunning and sly than any other creature in the garden that God had created. They asked the woman ``Is it true that God has forbidden you to eat from any tree in the garden?''

title: Genesis
text: The woman said to the serpent: `We are allowed to eat the fruit from the trees in the garden,

title: Genesis
text: but God has forbidden us from eating or touching the fruit from the tree in the middle of the garden, lest we perish.'

title: Genesis
text: The serpent told the woman `You will not die.

title: Genesis
text: God knows that once you consume it your eyes will be opened and you will be like God, knowing the distinction between good and evil, just like a deity.'

title: Genesis
text: Upon seeing that the fruit from the tree appeared safe to eat, was pleasing to the eye, and would make her wise, the woman took some of its fruit and ate it. She also gave some to Adam, her husband, who also ate it.

title: Genesis
text: Suddenly, Adam and the woman's eyes were open, and they realized that they were naked. They rushed to fashion garments out of fig leaves to cover themselves.

title: Genesis
text: During the cooler hours of the day, they heard God walking through the garden and hid from God among the trees.

title: Genesis
text: But God called to Adam and said `Where are you, Adam?'.

title: Genesis
text: He said `I heard you walking through the garden and I was scared because I am naked.'

title: Genesis
text: God asked Adam `Who informed you that you were naked? Did you consume the fruit from the tree which I instructed you to avoid?'.

title: Genesis
text: Adam said `the woman, my companion, she presented me with the fruit from the tree and I consumed it'.

title: Genesis
text: God then asked the woman `What have you done?', and she replied `The serpent tricked me and I ate the fruit from the tree.'

title: Genesis
text: God then turned towards the serpent and said `As punishment for your actions, you are cursed more so than any other animal, and more than any wild creature in the field. You will crawl on your belly and consume dust for the rest of your life.

title: Genesis
text: Your relationship with the descendants of the woman will be a hostile one. They will crush your head and you will strike at their heels.'

title: Genesis
text: God then told the woman `The labor pains of your pregnancy will be greatly increased, and you will experience great distress while giving birth. Adam will exert authority over you.'

title: Genesis
text: And to Adam, God said `Because you obeyed your companion and ate the fruit from the tree which I forbade you from eating, the ground is now cursed and you will have to work hard to gather food.

title: Genesis
text: The land will produce thorns and thistles, and you will have to eat the vegetation from the fields.

title: Genesis
text: And after your hard work gathering your food until you die, you shall return to the dust, for that is where you came from. From the dust you came, and to the dust you will return.'

title: Genesis
text: Twas then that Adam named the woman Eve, The Life Spring, as she was to be the source of life for all living beings.

title: Genesis
text: God crafted Adam and Eve tunics made from animal hides and clothed them.

title: Genesis
text: God then said `Look, Adam has become like Us, able to distinguish between good and evil. We must not let them reach out and take fruit from the Tree of Life and eat it, or they will live forever.'

title: Genesis
text: Consequently, God cast them out of the Garden of Eden to cultivate the soil from which Adam had come from.

title: Genesis
text: God expelled Adam and Eve and placed Cherubim and a fiery sword at the eastern entrance. The flaming sword moved in all directions to guard the Tree of Life.
